item.title: @PessoaBrain @DrBreaky @CVakalopoulos I explicitly don't say that and think that our addiction to causation is misguided. I just say very loudly that a correlational study should not make causal claims. So correlational study with causal claims in the discussion will get me to say something.

item.title: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am sorry but what brain activity? the attentional focus on the methods is a red herring. What the results imply is that the dynamics of fMRI BOLD signals has little to do with neural dynamics. I am ok with that conclusion.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am sorry but what brain activity? the attentional focus on the methods is a red herring. What the results imply is that the dynamics of fMRI BOLD signals has little to do with neural dynamics. I am ok with that conclusion.
item.content:encoded: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am sorry but what brain activity? the attentional focus on the methods is a red herring. What the results imply is that the dynamics of fMRI BOLD signals has little to do with neural dynamics. I am ok with that conclusion.

item.title: @BoninLab @KordingLab I agree that it is more accurate to say that this tells us about the dynamics of BOLD - and the relationship to activity dynamics might be complicated. But, what makes you say that these results show that BOLD has little to do with neural activity?
item.description: @BoninLab @KordingLab I agree that it is more accurate to say that this tells us about the dynamics of BOLD - and the relationship to activity dynamics might be complicated. But, what makes you say that these results show that BOLD has little to do with neural activity?

item.title: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab Is there is any BOLD dynamics not captured? fMRI BOLD is like the pixel values of a camera pointed at an extremely large symphonic orchestra where by strings and keys have subpixel resolution. The camera will reveal rhythm and notes onset, not the mechanics of music generation.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab Is there is any BOLD dynamics not captured? fMRI BOLD is like the pixel values of a camera pointed at an extremely large symphonic orchestra where by strings and keys have subpixel resolution. The camera will reveal rhythm and notes onset, not the mechanics of music generation.
item.content:encoded: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab Is there is any BOLD dynamics not captured? fMRI BOLD is like the pixel values of a camera pointed at an extremely large symphonic orchestra where by strings and keys have subpixel resolution. The camera will reveal rhythm and notes onset, not the mechanics of music generation.

item.title: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am actually serious. Yes fMRI BOLD correlates with neural activity. This may have some value in clinical applications, I can't judge. But for investigations of neural dynamics, the precious money should be invested in large-scale human electrical recordings or other techniques.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am actually serious. Yes fMRI BOLD correlates with neural activity. This may have some value in clinical applications, I can't judge. But for investigations of neural dynamics, the precious money should be invested in large-scale human electrical recordings or other techniques.
item.content:encoded: @tyrell_turing @KordingLab I am actually serious. Yes fMRI BOLD correlates with neural activity. This may have some value in clinical applications, I can't judge. But for investigations of neural dynamics, the precious money should be invested in large-scale human electrical recordings or other techniques.

item.title:
Some other thoughts: 1. is the issue with connectomics that we're not normalizing correctly, e.g. comparing group-averages of connectivity and activity? (going off @DrBreaky 's QA: https://t.co/vz5wHR2uvl)
2. Can connectomes add info when mixed in a model with spatial info?

item.title:
Fermat believed that he had discovered a formula that produced only primes.
It was only after his death that Euler proved him wrong when he found factors for the "fifth Fermat prime":
2^(2^5) + 1 = 2³² + 1 = 4,294,967,297 = 641 × 6,700,417 https://t.co/45RDekpzeF

item.title: The world was making huge progress in reducing child deaths and poverty, but global crises set us back. African countries are particularly vulnerable, with high food prices, crushing debt, and increasing rates of TB and malaria. That’s why I’m heading to West Africa next.
item.description: The world was making huge progress in reducing child deaths and poverty, but global crises set us back. African countries are particularly vulnerable, with high food prices, crushing debt, and increasing rates of TB and malaria. That’s why I’m heading to West Africa next.

item.title: Solving problems like climate change, health inequity and food insecurity requires innovation. From developing malaria drugs to investing in climate adaptation, China has a lot of experience in that. We need to unlock that kind of progress for more people around the world.
item.description: Solving problems like climate change, health inequity and food insecurity requires innovation. From developing malaria drugs to investing in climate adaptation, China has a lot of experience in that. We need to unlock that kind of progress for more people around the world.

Ice floats on oil, but when it melts, it turns into liquid water which won't float on oil, so it falls to the bottom. It's all a matter of density
Oil 0.91-0.93 g/mL Ice 0.92 g/mL Water 1.00 g/mL

item.title:
UPDATE: Interceptor Barricade is now operational, and we have extracted over 850,000 kg of trash in the last few weeks.
Now we await the real test: a heavy flood and a trash tsunami bringing hundreds of tons of plastic in just a few hours to fully validate our solution. https://t.co/5wVtCv7iNG
